intro: Jussiaea erythrocaulis, commonly known as the red-stemmed bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, bladder-like structures that trap tiny aquatic organisms. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its leaves are simple and often submerged, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous, appearing in clusters. Jussiaea erythrocaulis plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and serving as a food source for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
